search.title: Search for MMR vaccinations
search.instructions: Choose a date or a One Click option.

about.title: About the MMR Vaccine Finder
about.instructions:
This map provides locations that guarantee MMR vaccine will be in-stock and available. If preferred, we recommend that individuals call ahead to their healthcare provider or closest pharmacy to check on MMR vaccine availability prior to walking in for vaccination. For information about measles and the MMR vaccine, head over to the Chicago Department of Public Health's web site.

This web application was built and hosted by Tom Kompare in partnership with the Chicago Department of Public Health (CDPH). The measles vaccine data is owned and hosted by the City Of Chicago Data Portal. This web application was not developed by CDPH and CDPH makes no representations as to the accuracy of the information provided by this map application. The code behind this web application is free, open, and under an MIT License (see below).

help.title: How to use the MMR Vaccine Finder
help.instructions:
This map provides locations that guarantee MMR vaccine will be in-stock and available. If preferred, we recommend that individuals call ahead to their healthcare provider or closest pharmacy to check on MMR vaccine availability prior to walking in for vaccination. For information about measles and the MMR vaccine, head over to the Chicago Department of Public Health's web site.

The vaccine finder is built with you in mind. Find a convenient measles shot by clicking on a map pin or narrow your choices by using the search button. There are several ways to search: by date, today, tomorrow, this weekend, or look for all free events.

Blue pins on the map are Chicago Department of Public Health sponsored event locations offering the MMR vaccine at no cost to you. Red pins are other locations offering the MMR vaccine. Grey pins are single-day events that have already happened.

errordata.title: Error: No valid data source identified.
errordata.instructions: Please check "Source" in the configure.json file, and consult the web application installation instructions found at, Tom Kompare's Vaccinate Github project.

errorlocate.title: We're sorry. We could not find you.
errorlocate.instructions: Check your device's settings to make sure location services are turned on. You may be in an area where your device cannot be conveniently located.
